meanings.definition: A type of German song, especially of the Romantic period, typically for solo voice with piano accompaniment.
meanings.sent1: She sang beautiful lieder at the concert last night.
meanings.sent2: The music class will be performing lieder pieces next week.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed along as if it were singing lieder.
meanings.sent4: His heartache was expressed through the haunting lieder he composed.
meanings.sent5: The lieder echoed through the hall, captivating everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: Plural form of lied, a German art song.
meanings.sent1: The choir sang various lieder during the festival.
meanings.sent2: The lieder of Schubert are renowned for their emotional depth.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seemed to chirp in perfect lieder harmony.
meanings.sent4: The lieder filled the room with a sense of nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: Listening to the lieder brought back memories of childhood summers.
